acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours LC50=0.124microg/L of the crustacea (Penaeus Monodon) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 850mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 0.45mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 51mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.44 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests, in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse somatic cells and  in vivo chromosome aberration tests on rat somatic cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of parental reproduction and pup development toxicity observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)) and rabbit/rat teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983, 1992)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 31-32degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)): "Non-irritating to the eye."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)): "Slight erythematous responses were noted at 24 hours. By 72 hours, the reactions cleared up" (though the Draize score is not presented).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on no evidence of skin sensitization observed in guinea pig skin sensitization studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 17.8ppm (22-23degC), Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In animal studies, plasmic/corpusclar cholinesterase inhibition and increased liver weight were observed. However, classification is not possible due to lack of data, since no evidence of other common symptoms or histopathological abnormalities was reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including crouching position, tremors, relaxation, salivation and incontinence (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)). The effects on the nervous system were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
